total_revenue.context: Q3 2020 net sales increased to $96.1 billion, up 37% year-over-year. Excluding the $691 million favorable impact from foreign exchange rates, net sales grew by 36% compared to Q3 2019.
total_revenue.fx_impact: Foreign exchange rates had a favorable impact of $691 million on net sales growth.

net_sales.context: North America net sales increased to $59.373 billion, up 39% year-over-year.

operating_expenses.context: Operating expenses for North America increased to $57.121 billion, up 37% year-over-year.

operating_income.context: Operating income for North America increased to $2.252 billion in Q3 2020, compared with $1.564 billion in Q3 2019.

net_sales.context: International net sales increased to $25.171 billion, up 37% year-over-year.

operating_expenses.context: Operating expenses for International increased to $24.764 billion, up 38% year-over-year.

operating_income.context: Operating income for International increased to $0.407 billion in Q3 2020, compared with a loss of $0.386 billion in Q3 2019.

net_sales.context: AWS net sales increased to $11.601 billion, up 29% year-over-year.

operating_expenses.context: Operating expenses for AWS increased to $8.066 billion, up 19% year-over-year.

operating_income.context: Operating income for AWS increased to $3.535 billion in Q3 2020, compared with $2.121 billion in Q3 2019.

net_sales.context: Consolidated net sales increased to $96.145 billion, up 37% year-over-year.

operating_expenses.context: Consolidated operating expenses increased to $89.951 billion, up 38% year-over-year.

operating_income.context: Consolidated operating income increased to $6.194 billion in Q3 2020, compared with $3.157 billion in Q3 2019.

total_expenses.context: Consolidated operating expenses for Q3 2020 were $89.951 billion, up 38% from $66.824 billion in Q3 2019.
key_factors: Expanded marketing and general administrative expenses

COGS.context: Cost of goods sold increased to $75 million in Q3 2020.

Fulfillment.context: Fulfillment expenses increased to $316 million in Q3 2020.

Technology_and_content.context: Technology and content expenses increased to $1.267 billion in Q3 2020.

Marketing.context: Marketing expenses increased to $446 million in Q3 2020.

General_and_administrative.context: General and administrative expenses increased to $184 million in Q3 2020.

Other.context: WW shipping costs increased to $15.063 billion in Q3 2020.

Stock_based_Compensation.context: Total stock-based compensation expense increased to $2.288 billion in Q3 2020.

operating_income.context: Consolidated operating income increased to $6.194 billion in Q3 2020, compared with $3.157 billion in Q3 2019.

net_income.context: Net income increased to $6.3 billion in Q3 2020, compared with $2.134 billion in Q3 2019.

eps.context: Net income of $6.3 billion translates to $12.37 per diluted share in Q3 2020, compared with $4.23 per diluted share in Q3 2019.

free_cash_flow.context: Free cash flow increased to $29.5 billion for the trailing twelve months, up from $23.5 billion the previous year.

operating_cash_flow.context: Operating cash flow increased 56% to $55.3 billion for the trailing twelve months.

free_cash_flow_less_principal_repayments.context: Free cash flow less principal repayments of finance leases and financing obligations increased to $18.4 billion for the trailing twelve months, compared with $14.6 billion the previous year.

free_cash_flow_less_equipment_and_other_.context: Free cash flow less equipment finance leases and principal repayments of all other finance leases and financing obligations increased to $17.9 billion for the trailing twelve months, compared with $10.5 billion the previous year.

capital_expenditures.context: Invested over $10 billion in Project Kuiper, a low earth orbit satellite constellation initiative.

share_repurchase.context: Share repurchase details not provided in the provided information.

monthly_active_users.context: No specific user metrics provided in the provided information.

total_employees.context: Employees (full-time and part-time; excludes contractors & temporary personnel) increased to 1,125,300 in Q3 2020, up 50% year-over-year.

market_position.description: Amazon continues to lead in various sectors including e-commerce, cloud computing, and digital streaming.
initiatives: Expansion of AWS regions and services
Launch of Amazon Go Grocery and Just Walk Out Technology
Introduction of new Alexa-enabled devices and features
goals: Maintain leadership in e-commerce and cloud services
Expand technological innovations in AI and automation
Enhance customer satisfaction and service offerings
examples: Ranked #1 in American Customer Satisfaction Index Internet Retail Category
Launch of Prime Video Cinema in multiple countries
AWS expansion to 76 Availability Zones within 24 regions

innovation.description: Amazon is focused on innovation across its platforms including AWS, Alexa, and Prime Video to enhance customer experience and operational efficiency.
initiatives: Development of Amazon Detective and Amazon Keyspaces for AWS
Introduction of new Alexa speaking styles for more natural interactions
Expansion of Fire TV content catalog internationally
Launch of Ring Blink Mini and enhanced security features
goals: Provide advanced security and database services through AWS
examples: General availability of Amazon Detective and Amazon Keyspaces
Alexa available on more devices including LG and Samsung Smart TVs
Ring introduced new video doorbells and security cameras

acquisitions.description: Amazon continues to grow through strategic acquisitions to enhance its product and service offerings.
initiatives: Integration of acquired companies into existing platforms
Expansion of service capabilities through acquisitions
goals: Strengthen market position in key sectors
Enhance technological capabilities and service offerings
examples: Not explicitly detailed in the provided information.

ecosystem_development.description: Amazon is expanding its ecosystem through the introduction of new services and partnerships to enhance customer engagement and satisfaction.
initiatives: Launch of Amazon Go Grocery and Just Walk Out Technology to retailers
Prime Video's partnerships with NFL and expansion of content
goals: Increase convenience and innovation in retail
Enhance digital streaming offerings and partnerships
Expand AWS services and regional availability
examples: Amazon Go Grocery in Woodland Hills and Irvine, CA
Prime Video's multi-year agreement with NFL
AWS Europe (Milan) and AWS Africa (Cape Town) regions

social_initiatives.description: Amazon is committed to supporting its employees and communities, especially during challenging times.
initiatives: Investments in COVID-19 related expenses to protect employees and ensure safety
Support for frontline workers through various initiatives
goals: Ensure the safety and well-being of employees
examples: Spending over $4 billion on COVID-19-related costs
Paid a special thank you bonus of over $500 million to frontline employees and delivery partners
Offering jobs with industry-leading pay and great healthcare

factors: Increased demand for online shopping and AWS services
Expansion of Prime Video and other subscription services
Growth in AWS infrastructure and service offerings
